member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ChartNode.CheckIfInvalidRefAndComplain(System.Object)
member.summary:
Checks if the given object is null or disposed, and complains if it's not and returns true.
Idea of this is to do sanity checks on methods, allowing testing of object references required in the method.
Disposed check is done only on ChartNodes
Call this with required refs, and if the return value is false, exit the method or do something, but skip the usage and try to get out of the situation gracefully.
Notifies the user through . Null objects cause message and disposed objects cause type message.
Severity is always .
member.param: Item of which validity is to be checked.
member.returns: True if there was some problem with the reference.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ChartNode.CheckIfInvalidRefAndComplain(System.Object[])
member.summary:
Checks if any of the given objects are null or disposed, and complains to user if they are, and returns true.
Idea of this is to do sanity checks on methods, allowing testing of object references required in the method.
This works identically to , but accepts multiple objects.
Disposed check is done only on ChartNodes
Call this with required refs, and if the return value is false, exit the method or do something, but skip the usage and try to get out of the situation gracefully.
Notifies the user through . Null objects cause message and disposed objects cause type message.
Severity is always .
member.param: Item of which validity is to be checked.
member.returns: True if there was some problem with any of the references.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ChartTools.ConvertDataToColorsByFixedIntervalPalette(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Windows.Media.Color[])
member.summary: Convert data values to colors, by given palette. Palette is defined by steps, consisting of value and corresponding color. E.g. 0 : Black, 50: Yellow, 100: Red. The output colors are interpolated based on their position between steps. E.g. in this example palette, data value 60 will be almost yellow, but a little bit blending with red.
member.param: Values of palette. Count must be equal to step color count.
Colors of palette. Count must be equal to step value count.

member.summary: Convert double array into colors, by using gradient fixed-interval palette.
member.param: Jagged array matrix, M x N.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ChartUpdateTypes
member.summary: Defines how/when chart is updated and new frames are rendered.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ChartUpdateTypes.Sync
member.summary: Chart is updated in sync fashion on property changes. This is the fastest way to get most performance out of the chart and to minimize latency.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ChartUpdateTypes.Async
member.summary: Chart is updated on async fashion. The chart will update as fast as possible after property changes, but the property changes will return as fast as possible, and chart will render new frame at some later point.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ChartUpdateTypes.LimitedFrameRate
member.summary:
Chart will limit the framerate of the updates to value defined by .
This is similar to the Async option, but keeps prevents new frames to be rendered right after another, thus reducing framerate, but sparing system resources.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.EnhancedAntiAliasing
member.summary: Enhanced anti-aliasing. Anti-aliasing is made in GPU shader. This is useful especially for GPUs that don't support anti-aliasing in GPU hardware. Provides better visual quality and clearness of lines than hardware anti-aliasing.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.EnhancedAntiAliasing.IfNotSupportedByHardware
member.summary: Use only if anti-aliasing is not supported in hardware.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.EnhancedAntiAliasing.Off
member.summary: Don't use enhanced anti-aliasing. Anti-aliasing in hardware is used, if it's supported and enabled in object's settings.

member.summary: Unable to allocate memory for operation. You should run the garbage collection GC.Collect(), and then try the operation again

member.summary: Invalid property value has been set

member.summary: Render device is not available anymore

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.RenderInvalidCall
member.summary: Rendering caused invalid call exception. Possibly caused by updating chart from a separate thread without synchronizing it with main program thread. You should use BeginInvoke or Invoke methods for synchronization.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.RenderDeviceSurfaceHasWrongSize
member.summary: The renderer created a drawing surface whose size does not match the parent control's client size.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.InvalidSeriesResolverDataWithSeriesEventMarker
member.summary: Series data X coordinate to Y coordinate resolver data has become invalid, because points have been added. Do not use markers as 'TrackSeries' with X axis monitoring monitoring scroll modes. Instead, you should define them as 'AtYValue' and convert them 'TrackSeries' when opening data in review mode, and set the scroll mode to 'None'.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.SeriesIsNotTrackable
member.summary: You are requesting a tracking operation on a series, that is not trackable (does not implement ITrackable)

member.summary: Samples use different format than you try to use

member.summary: Invalid save file format. E.g. one can't save 3D graph as vector.

member.summary: IsBindableDataUsed is 'true' but non-bindable data collection (e.g. PointLineSeries.Points) is modified instead of bindable data collection (e.g. PointLineSeries.PointsWpf).

member.summary: Axis index for axis related item is invalid.

member.summary: Item view differs from drawing view.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.FrontBufferAvailable
member.summary: Fast WPF presentation element has retrieved the front buffer, and normal presentation of the LC can continue.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ErrorType.FrontBufferNotAvailable
member.summary: Fast WPF presentation element has lost the front buffer, and LC cannot be presented using it. This can happen for multiple different valid and normal reasons, like hiding of the window, changing to different tab, using through remote desktop, etc, and usually does not require attention. After this the chart will try to use slower fallback presentation method.

member.summary: Enumeration specifying how the smith grid are to be formed. For more information, see AxisSmith.GridType property.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.GridTypeSmith.Distance
member.summary:
Determine gridline positions so that each line is positioned in a point where the value is nice and event, and distance to other lines is approximately value set in GridDivSpacing.
For more information on actual positioning, see the GridDivSpacing property of AxisSmith.

member.summary: Determine gridline positions so that specific number of gridlines are placed on even distances from the center line, that is always drawn. Number of gridlines can be set using GridDivCount property. See that for more information about positioning of the gridlines.

member.param: Arguments to use instead of current objects stored MouseEvent arguments. Can be used to speed up speed up the call if the event is already constructed. Note that the object is not updated in any way if given, so it can be used to deliver wrong information.
member.returns:
Return value of the Charts RaiseEvent method. False if the event could not be emitted, true otherwise.
True emitting of the event succeeds. If no event listeners is registered, this should return true.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.HighlightingItemBase.SetHighlight
member.summary:
Highlights the object.
This is a kind of "forced" highlight, and the object might be highlighted even if the highlighting type (defined by MouseHighlight property) is set to None. How the highlighting happens, if any, depends on object. Most objects use the defined type by default, and fall back to Simple highlighting if None is set.

member.summary: Default constructor. Creates new LightningChartUltimate object.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.LightningChartUltimate.#ctor(Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderingSettings)
member.summary:
Creates new LightningChartUltimate object.
Takes parameter that can be used in defining certain settings on creation time. Note that some of the settings are dangerous to use, and the constructor itself is intended for advanced use. In normal situation it's better to use the default parameterless constructor.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.LightningChartUltimate.CaptureToByteArray(System.Int32@,System.Int32@,Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.PixelFormat@)
member.summary:
Get the last frame rendered by the chart as byte array containing just pixel data four bytes per pixel.
To get the image data with headers, like in bpm or png format, use SaveToStream method
member.returns: chart's last rendered raw image as byte array. Each pixel is represented by 4 bytes in the order defined by the format parameter.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.LightningChartUltimate.GetBeginUpdateCount
member.summary:
Get effectively used BeginUpdate/EndUpdate counter. Use for debugging, if seems that chart does not render.
The value must be 0 in order for the chart to render. If value is larger, some BeginUpdate call has not been closed by matching EndUpdate call.
This indicates total value. Use GetBeginUpdateCountPublic to see difference of public - user called - BeginUpdate / EndUpdate methods.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.LightningChartUltimate.GetBeginUpdateCountPublic
member.summary: Get public BeginUpdate/EndUpdate counter. Use for debugging, if seems that chart does not render. Must be zero after EndUpdate(), if one wants chart to render.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.LightningChartUltimate.GetLastEngineInitResults
member.summary:
returns a list of EngineInitResult objects of which each defines a tried engine, if its initialization was successful or not and the reasons why its initialization failed.
This method is intended for debugging purposes.
The information applies to the last time the engine was tried to be initialized. The list is recreated each time engine initialization is tried and the old information is lost.
member.returns: List describing lastly tried engines and result of the initialization

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.LightningChartUltimate.GetLastOutputStreamFormat

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.LightningChartUltimate.GetLastOutputStreamSize
member.summary: Getter of the image size of the last image written to OutputStream as pixels (not DIP's).
member.returns: Size of the last image written to OutputStream.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.LightningChartUltimate.InitializeRenderingDevice(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Tries to force the engine initialization in a synchronous fashion. Should have no use in WinForms. On WPF the engine is by default initialized only when it's put to visual tree (OnLoad event) or on device type setting if on headless mode.
This method allows user to force the rendering device initialization.
member.param: Forces engine reinitialization, even if there should be no reason for it.
member.returns: true if the call resulted in valid engine that is different from the previous one.

member.summary: Check if hardware rendering is supported.
member.param: Hardware available by querying adapters in the system
Hardware may have been disable by HKEY_CURRENT_USER\\Software\\Microsoft\\Avalon.Graphics\\DisableHWAcceleration flag. Outputs false if so.
member.returns: True if all is enabled, and thus supports hardware rendering

Event for DPI change.
Subscribe to this event to receive information of changes on the DPI and to enable automatic LightningChart resizing / repositioning application window on DPI changes. See for more information.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.LightningChartUltimate.OutputStream
member.summary:
Stream to write the rendered frame bitmaps to.
Defaults to null. Set the stream to this property and it will be written with ran data of the images on every frame. See remarks for the format.
This property is intended as the fastest way to capture continuous frames from the chart, especially on Headless mode.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MathRoutines
member.summary: Chart tools provides versatile static methods

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MathRoutines.AngleDegInFirstFullCircle(System.Double)
member.summary:
Retrieve the input angle value as positive angle of the first full rotation in degrees.
Note that the range contains 0, but not the "full angle" of 360 degrees.
member.param: Angle to find the equivalent angle in degrees.
member.returns: Angle matching the input in first full positive round as degrees.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MathRoutines.AngleDiffDeg(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Solve smallest absolute difference between two angles in degrees. This takes in account the periodic nature of the values, meaning that full circles do not affect the difference.
Useful in comparing the difference of angles, e.g. on testing if angles are the same.
Note that the type of angle unit affects the result. Use for radians.
member.param: One of the angles to calculate the difference between in degrees. Order of parameter does not matter.
One of the angles to calculate the difference between in degrees. Order of parameter does not matter.
member.returns: Difference of provided angles in degrees. Always positive.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MathRoutines.AngleDiffRad(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Solve smallest absolute difference between two angles in radians. This takes in account the periodic nature of the values, meaning that full circles do not affect the difference.
Useful in comparing the difference of angles, e.g. on testing if angles are the same.
Note that the type of angle unit affects the result. Use for degrees and examples.
member.param: One of the angles to calculate the difference between in radians. Order of parameter does not matter.
One of the angles to calculate the difference between in radians. Order of parameter does not matter.
member.returns: Difference of provided angles in radians. Always positive.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MathRoutines.AngleRadInFirstFullCircle(System.Double)
member.summary:
Retrieve the input angle value as positive angle of the first full rotation in radians.
Note that the range contains 0, but not the "full angle" of PI radians.
member.param: Angle to find the equivalent angle in radians.
member.returns: Angle matching the input in first full positive round as radians.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MathRoutines.LinearFitSolveFactors(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Calculate linear fit from given points. Makes best fit with Least Square regression method. A line equation is y = k*x + b, that is, y = gradient * x + coefficient
member.param: Coefficient, Y value of intersection where X = 0

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MathRoutines.LinearRegression(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Calculate linear line fit for given points
member.param: X values that are used to calculate the factors. This is the point set where the regression line is fitted to.
Y values that are used to calculate the factors. Length must be equal to xInFactorization length.
X values whose Y values are to be solved, using the factors
member.returns: Fitted Y values, the length equals to xValuesToFit length. Returns null if failed.

member.summary: Calculates intersection point of two lines. Line 1: goes through A1 and A2. Line 2: goes through B1 and B2. Algorithm copied from http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/lineline2d/
member.returns: Success status. Returns false if could not solve the intersection.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MathRoutines.PolynomialRegression(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate polymial line fit. Calculates polynomial factors, and uses these factors to solve Y values based on given X value array.
member.param: X values that are used to calculate the factors. This is the point set where the regression line is fitted to.
Y values that are used to calculate the factors. Length must be equal to xInFactorization length.
X values whose Y values are to be solved, using the factors
Order of polynomial. Usually more than 3 shouldn't be used
member.returns: Fitted Y values, the length equals to xValuesToFit length. Returns null if failed.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MathRoutines.PolynomialRegression(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Calculate polymial line fit. Calculates polynomial factors, and uses these factors to solve Y values based on given X value array.
member.param: X values that are used to calculate the factors. This is the point set where the regression line is fitted to.
Y values that are used to calculate the factors. Length must be equal to xInFactorization length.
X values whose Y values are to be solved, using the factors
Order of polynomial. Usually more than 3 shouldn't be used
Polynomial result factors, length = order+1. For example, when having order 2, you can plot line with equation: Y = factors[0] + factors[1]*X + factors[2]*X^2
member.returns: Fitted Y values, the length equals to xValuesToFit length. Returns null if failed.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageSeverity
member.summary: Tells the severity level of ChartMessage event. Used to determine which kind of actions should be taken on the message event.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageSeverity.NoMinimumLevel
member.summary: NoMinimumLevel is only used in setting ChartMessageMinimumLevel to allow all messages to be sent to the user. Should not be used in ChartMessage events as this will cause a warning.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageSeverity.Debug
member.summary: Debug message. The user is usually not interested in this.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageSeverity.Information
member.summary: Information, not an error. Should not require any actions from the user. Some incorrect usage of LightningChart has happened which shouldn't impact chart performance.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageSeverity.Warning
member.summary: Warning, not an error. User action might be required. Incorrect usage of LightningChart has happened, like setting an illegal property value or mismatching data point types which might cause minor problems with the application.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageSeverity.RecoverableError
member.summary: An error happened that should have been recovered. User action might be required. User must listen to ChartMessage events or the message will be thrown as an exception.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageSeverity.UnrecoverableError
member.summary: An error happened in the application that the chart couldn't recover from. User must listen to ChartMessage events or the message will be thrown as an exception.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageSeverity.Critical
member.summary: Critical error, will result in an exception in all cases.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType
member.summary: Detailed information about the type of the ChartMessage event

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.MemoryAllocationError
member.summary: Unable to allocate memory for operation. You should run the garbage collection GC.Collect(), and then try the operation again

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.InvalidPropertySetting
member.summary: Invalid property value has been set

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.InvalidSeriesResolverDataWithSeriesEventMarker
member.summary: Series data X coordinate to Y coordinate resolver data has become invalid, because points have been added. Do not use markers as 'TrackSeries' with X axis monitoring monitoring scroll modes. Instead, you should define them as 'AtYValue' and convert them 'TrackSeries' when opening data in review mode, and set the scroll mode to 'None'.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.SeriesIsNotTrackable
member.summary: You are requesting a tracking operation on a series, that is not trackable (does not implement ITrackable)

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.SampleFormatMismatch
member.summary: Samples use different format than you try to use

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.DataPointTypeMismatch
member.summary: Series has been configured to use different data point type than you are trying to use

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.InvalidLogAxisOperation
member.summary: The selected feature can't be used with logarithmic axis

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.ShaderModel3NotSupported
member.summary: Shader model 3 is not supported by the GPU. Some parts of the chart cannot be drawn as intended.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.BeginUpdateEndUpdateCallCountMismatch
member.summary: EndUpdate() is called more often than BeginUpdate().

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.InvalidSaveFileFormat
member.summary: Invalid save file format. E.g. one can't save 3D graph as vector.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.DataBindingCollectionMisuse
member.summary: IsBindableDataUsed is 'true' but non-bindable data collection (e.g. PointLineSeries.Points) is modified instead of bindable data collection (e.g. PointLineSeries.PointsWpf).

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.InvalidAxisIndexForSeries
member.summary: Axis index for axis related item is invalid.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.InvalidSegmentForYAxis
member.summary: Segment or segment index for y-axis is invalid.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.InvalidOwnerViewForItem
member.summary: Item view differs from drawing view.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.LicensingError
member.summary: Problem with licensing. Make sure the license is properly installed.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.EventSystemError
member.summary: Problem delivering or calling client side event handlers.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.DrawingOfImageFailed
member.summary: Some exception occurred when graphics object tried to draw image.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.DisposedObjectAction
member.summary: Illegal update action on a disposed object detected.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.ParentSharingError
member.summary: Chart objects parent changed. This could indicate sharing chart's object between multiple parents which is not supported.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.ProblematicCameraOrientation
member.summary:
Requested camera orientation is problematic and might result in different result than expected.
This is similar to but more specific. At this case the user defined camera orientation was somehow problematic on current settings.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.CameraPositioningFailed
member.summary:
Some problem appeared with positioning 3D camera or some other viewpoint / view area.
This is similar to but more general.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.EngineReinitialization
member.summary: Something caused the rendering engine to reinitialize.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.RenderDeviceIsLost
member.summary: Render device is not available anymore.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.RenderInvalidCall
member.summary: Rendering caused invalid call exception. Possibly caused by updating chart from a separate thread without synchronizing it with main program thread. You should use BeginInvoke or Invoke methods for synchronization.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.FrontBufferAvailable
member.summary: Fast WPF presentation element has retrieved the front buffer, and normal presentation of the LC can continue.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.FrontBufferNotAvailable
member.summary: Fast WPF presentation element has lost the front buffer, and LC cannot be presented using it. This can happen for multiple different valid and normal reasons, like hiding of the window, changing to different tab, using through remote desktop, etc, and usually does not require attention. After this the chart will try to use slower fallback presentation method.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.SharpDXBufferCreationError
member.summary: Error on creation of SharpDX Buffer.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.RequirementsNotMet
member.summary: Some of the requirements are not met. Details might present more information.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.ResourceHandlingError
member.summary: Some suspicios or alarming happened with resource management (memory, handles.. ) This might result in rendering device being lost and hopefully reacquired.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.ImagePresentationTimeout
member.summary:
Presentation of image has encountered a timeout problem.
This might be because of a large things to draw, slow system etc, but might indicate a real problem as well.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.RenderingDeviceBlacklisted
member.summary: Use of the detected GPU has been blacklisted for the given purpose.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.LoadingFromFileFailed
member.summary: Load from a file operation failed.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.MessageType.CantCompleteOperation
member.summary: Requested operation was not finished. Zooming, drawing or some other operation did not finish as expected. Output might differ from expected. Details will elaborate the issue. .

summary.para: Camera orientation / rotation interpretation types, giving meaning for , and settings and their calculation order, thus affecting camera position and orientation. See remarks for generic information on camera placement and orientation. See different enumeration values and property for more information on available options, their usage and effects.
Camera position is defined as X-Y extrinsic rotation and camera up direction by world Z-axis rotation.
This was the only available angle property interpretation used in LC up to version 8.3.
This interpretation has some problematic features and will be deprecated in the future. It's highly suggested to move using interpretation. See Remarks for more information

member.summary: Tells if the rectangle is empty.

member.summary: Bitmap is drawn on front of gradient color.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.AllGPUs
member.summary: All GPUs installed in the system.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.Created
member.summary: Is the device created. If false, the other fields of this structure are not valid.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.D2Dv11Supported
member.summary: True if D2D v1.1 is supported, false if not. The v1.1 is required for HW text rendering on DX11. On DX9 this is always false.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.D3DImageUsed
member.summary: True if D3DImage was used in drawing of the last frame. Always false on WinForms.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.DpiAware
member.summary: True if software is DPI aware.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.FastVertexFormat
member.summary: True if your graphics adapter supports fast vertex format. Fast vertices are not available for old graphics adapters. If false, the rendering performance is not optimal, since slower vertex formats must be used. Getting a new graphics adapter is strongly recommended, ensure it is at least DirectX 10 level, for best performance.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.HardwareVertexProcessing
member.summary: True if your graphics adapter supports vertex processing in hardware (GPU). If false, the vertex calculation has to be done in software (computer CPU), and the performance is not optimal.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.IndexBuffers32Bit
member.summary: True if 32-bit index buffers are supported. If only 16-index buffers are supported, returns false. In this case the 3D surfaces may be limited into smaller sizes.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.Memory
member.summary: Memory on the graphics card (if information is available).

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.PureDevice
member.summary: True if optimal pure device mode is supported.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.ShaderModel3
member.summary: True if shader model 3 is supported. Both vertex and pixel shaders are format 3 or greater.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderDeviceInfo.TexturesSizesNonPowerOf2
member.summary: Limited support for textures which size is not power of two.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RendererDeviceType.Auto
member.summary: Automatic order suggested by Arction to be used for generally best results. Value can change based on current status of different engines.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RendererDeviceType.AutoPreferD9
member.summary: Automatic order, preferring DX9 over DX11. DX9 is currently slightly faster than DX11 especially on WPF.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RendererDeviceType.AutoPreferD11
member.summary: Automatic order, preferring DX11 over DX9. DX11 looks better and is more faster than DX9 on many occasions.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RendererDeviceType.HardwareOnlyD9
member.summary: Force hardware rendering for D9 device.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RendererDeviceType.SoftwareOnlyD9
member.summary: Force software rendering for D9 device.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RendererDeviceType.HardwareOnlyD11
member.summary: Force hardware rendering for D11 device.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RendererDeviceType.SoftwareOnlyD11
member.summary: Force software rendering for D11 device.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RendererDeviceType.None
member.summary: Defines that no engine is used or not to be used. This can be used to fully disable rendering on LightningChart, and thus save (free) resources required by the rendering system. After setting this as DeviceType, it might be useful to call GC.Collect() on some occasions.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderingSettings
member.summary:
Rendering settings, that can be given as chart constructor parameter to set the creation time parameters. Speeds up creating of the chart, if non-default values are given, preventing the chart rendering engine to be re-created several times.
Note that the values are only read once after the chart is created, and changing them later has no effect. To change values after chart has been created, use Charts ChartRenderOptions property on WPF, or RenderOptions property on WinForms, both of type
This object can be shared between multiple charts.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderingSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor for Form designer list editor.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderingSettings.AntiAliasLevel
member.summary: Anti-aliasing factor. 1 = no anti-aliasing. The larger the value, the smoother the image will be, but at steep cost of performance on some display adapters. Only objects having AntiAlias property will be anti-aliased, if it's set to 'Normal'.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderingSettings.ChartErrorDelegate
member.summary:
Delegate to register to the ChartError event. Initialized this way the chart error event is launched even before the object has been fully constructed.
Intended primarily as debug measure for cases when LC crashes on constructor and we need more information on why it happens.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderingSettings.ChartMessageDelegate
member.summary:
Delegate to register to the ChartMessage event. Initialized this way the chart error event is launched even before the object has been fully constructed.
Intended primarily as debug measure for cases when LC crashes on constructor and we need more information on why it happens.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderingSettings.D2DEnabled
member.summary: Temporary debug setting for disabling D2D system and text rendering on DX11.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderingSettings.DeviceType
member.summary: Default rendering device engine to use. Defaults to Auto.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderingSettings.HeadlessMode
member.summary: Identifies that we do not actually have a graphical interface. This is true for instance for services or console applications. This can also be used if the chart is intended to run on background without an actual interface.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RenderingSettings.WaitforVSync
member.summary: Wait for next refresh, V-Sync. If the computer is fast enough, disabling this can give higher refresh rate than the screen refresh rate is. By disabling this, rendering does not wait next screen refresh turn. Enabling this may improve performance especially in slow computers.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RightToLeftZoomAction3D.RectangleZoomIn
member.summary: Rectangle zoom in, like from zooming left to right.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.RightToLeftZoomActionRound.ZoomToData

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesEventMarkerVerticalPosition.TrackSeries
member.summary: Track the series. The Y value is solved from X value. You can use this only for series implementing ITrackable interface or with FreeformPointLineSeries. Not applicable in X-axis scrolling modes Scrolling, Stepping, Sweeping (monitoring modes). The resolver data is not valid for performance reasons. You should insert a marker as AtYValue in monitoring mode and convert it as TrackSeries when entering data review mode. Works only on series implementing ITrackable or with FreeformPointLineSeries.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.TextureWrapMode
member.summary: Texture wrapping. Descriptions copied from MSDN: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/bb322814(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.TextureWrapMode.Wrap
member.summary: Tiles the texture at every integer junction. For example, for u values between 0 and 3, the texture is repeated three times. No mirroring is performed.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.TextureWrapMode.Mirror
member.summary: Similar to Wrap, except that the texture is flipped at every integer junction. For u values between 0 and 1, for example, the texture is addressed normally; between 1 and 2, the texture is flipped (mirrored); between 2 and 3, the texture is normal again, and so on.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.TextureWrapMode.Clamp
member.summary: Texture coordinates outside the range [0.0, 1.0] are set to the texture color at 0.0 or 1.0, respectively.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.TextureWrapMode.Border
member.summary: Texture coordinates outside the range [0.0, 1.0] are set to the border color.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.TextureWrapMode.MirrorOnce
member.summary: Similar to Mirror and Clamp. Takes the absolute value of the texture coordinate (thus, mirroring around 0), and then clamps to the maximum value. The most common usage is for volume textures, where support for the full MirrorOnce texture-addressing mode is not necessary, but the data is symmetrical around the one axis.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.ViewAspectRatio.AutoLatitude
member.summary: Calculate aspect ratio based on view center latitude. Applicable only, when map is used. Y-axis center point defines the latitude, proper XY aspect ratio is calculated based in it and X-axis width is modified accordingly. This simulates the projection so that width of objects in the center of the screen are approximately of correct aspect ratio. The estimation can produce bad output on large scale and large center latitude values.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Annotations.AnnotationBase.Anchor
member.summary: Gets or sets anchor. This is a dependency property. Rotation uses this point as a center point. Tells where to place the anchored point within the control area. For X-dimension, value 0 represents left coordinate of the object and 1 right coordinate. For Y-dimension, value 0 represents top coordinate of the object and 1 bottom coordinate. To define anchor point outside the object area, define values outside range 0...1.

member.param: Absolute real axis value to normalize.
member.returns: Normalized real axis value. Normalized to range 0..1. Values outside this range do not fit in the Unit circle.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Axes.AxisY.Fit(System.Double,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fit axis minimum and maxium to show all series values. Note that first argument's value type defines Margin's units (Pixels or Percents).
member.param: Margin to leave between axis minimum or maximum and series values, in percents of minimum...maximum range.
Method sets this true if Y-axis minimum or maximum has changed.
If true, all series points are searched, resulting to better accuracy, but with a cost raised CPU load.
Ignore zeros values from logarithmic axis fitting.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Axes.AxisY.Fit(System.Double,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Fit axis minimum and maximum to show all series values, while keeping the range withing given limits. Note that first argument's value type defines Margin's units (Pixels or Percents).
member.param: Margin to leave between axis minimum or maximum and series values, in percents of minimum...maximum range.
Method sets this true if Y-axis minimum or maximum has changed.
If true, all series points are searched, resulting to better accuracy, but with a cost raised CPU load.
Ignore zeros values from logarithmic axis fitting.
Minimum limit. If detected minimum is below limit minimum, the limit applies.
Maximum limit. If detected minimum is below limit minimum, the limit applies.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Axes.AxisY.Fit(System.Int32,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fit axis minimum and maxium to show all series values. Note that first argument's value type defines Margin's units (Pixels or Percents).
member.param: Margin to leave between data and segment boundaries, in pixels of minimum...maximum range.

If true, all series points are searched, resulting to better accuracy, but with a cost raised CPU load.
Ignore zeros values from logarithmic axis fitting.

If true, all series points are searched, resulting to better accuracy, but with a cost raised CPU load.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.CoordinateConverters.SphericalCartesian3D
member.summary: Spherical to 3D cartesian coordinates converter class. Assumes spherical data point to be defined in azimuth / elevation system coordinates. For elevation, the XZ plane is the reference plane. (e.g. equatorial plane). Elevation is angle measured from that plane. To apply values from polar inclination system, use formula Elevation = 90 - Inclination.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.OverlayElements.OverlayElement.Anchor
member.summary: Rotation uses this point as a center point. Location tells where to place the anchored point on the control area. For X dimension, value 0 represents left coordinate of the object and 1 right coordinate. For Y dimension, value 0 represents top coordinate of the object and 1 bottom coordinate. To define anchor point outside the object area, define values outside range 0...1.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Series3D.SurfaceGridSeries3D.DrawWireframeThrough
member.summary: Gets or sets if draws wireframe through the filled surface. This is a dependency property. When true, wireframe is always visible from above the surface and below it. Alternatively, you may prefer setting this false and using WireframeOffset to shift the wireframe slightly up or down, making it visible only on the other side of the filled surface.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Series3D.SurfaceMeshSeries3D.DrawWireframeThrough
member.summary: Gets or sets if draws wireframe through the filled surface. This is a dependency property. When true, wireframe is always visible from above the surface and below it. Alternatively, you may prefer setting this false and using WireframeOffset to shift the wireframe slightly up or down, making it visible only on the other side of the filled surface.

member.summary: Set data values from X, Y, Z and color.
member.param: Color. Effects only if Fill is set to SourcePointColoring.
member.returns: False if invalid index. Otherwise true.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Series3D.SurfaceSeries3DBase.SetHeightDataFromBitmap(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Drawing.Bitmap,Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.BitmapAntialiasOptions,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create data based on bitmap file contents. Data array will have dimensions of the bitmap Width X Height. Use options to reduce resolution and smooth it if needed. Height data of is calculated for each pixel from R, G, and B sum. 0 (black) will have the minimum value, and maximum value is obtained from 3*255 (white). If bitmap has alpha value of 0, the data is set to -INF, and the value is not drawn.
member.param: Bitmap resolution decrement and smoothing options. Give null to use pure bitmap data only.
Sets NegativeInfinity when bitmap pixel has alpha = 0.
member.returns: True if data was successfully filled, else false.

member.summary: Solve nearest data point to given screen coordinate [input in DIP]. Takes the data point distance from camera into account. Only solves the point when coordinate is over the surface.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesXY.FreeformPointLineSeries.OldestPointIndex
member.summary: Gets the index of oldest point in Points array. When PointCountLimitEnabled is true, the Points array is used as an circular point buffer. This is 0 always when PointCountLimitEnabled is false. To read Points, when OldestPointIndex is 0: Read from index 0 till PointCount-1. To read Points, when OldestPointIndex is > 0: First read from OldestPointIndex till PointCountLimit-1. Then read from index 0 till OldestPointIndex-1.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesXY.HighLowSeriesBase.ScrollingStabilizing
member.summary: Gets or sets if stabilize scrolling mode by rounding shifting to nearest integer pixel position. This is a dependency property. Reduces wobbling of the scrolling waveform, but may show as slight X-dimensional distortion. Only applies when XAxis ScrollMode = Scrolling

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesXY.HighLowSeriesBase.ScrollModePointsKeepLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets how often the draw data is cleared when using X axis scroll mode. This is a dependency property. Valid range is 1...100 1 frees the draw data and the reconstucts the draw data after every 1/10 scroll page. Use this when there's not much memory available. 100 frees the draw data and the reconstucts the draw data after every 100/10 = 10 pages. Use this when smooth scroll with high FPS is important. Reserves some extra memory.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesXY.IntensitySeriesBase.Optimization
member.summary: Gets or sets optimization selection for the series usage. This is a dependency property. Use StaticData if data does not changed frequently, allowing faster updates when other objects in the chart are updating. DynamicData selection is better when the data is changed many times / second.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesXY.IntensitySeriesBase.RefreshRenderingData(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Rebuilds rendering data. Expert's method for allowing multi-threaded application to pre-build rendering data before rendering stage. Rendering stage must always be synchronized to main thread, but this call can be called parallel for every series of this type.
member.param: X-axis sweeping page index (set 0 if sweeping is not used).

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesXY.IRealtimeShiftable
member.summary: Interface flag for series that can be - Shifted in real-time, by using incremental rendering data construction, with XAxis.ScrollMode == Scrolling/Sweeping/Stepping, and setting XAxis.ScrollPosition periodically. These series implementing this interface are very powerful in rendering of data that is appended in real-time.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesXY.PointLineSeries.ScrollingStabilizing
member.summary: Gets or sets if stabilize scrolling mode by rounding shifting to nearest integer pixel position. This is a dependency property. Reduces wobbling of the scrolling waveform, but may show as slight X-dimensional distortion. Only applies when XAxis ScrollMode = Scrolling

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesXY.PointLineSeries.ScrollModePointsKeepLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets how often the draw data is cleared when using X axis scroll mode. This is a dependency property. Valid range is 1...100 1 frees the draw data and the reconstucts the draw data after every 1/10 scroll page. Use this when there's not much memory available. 100 frees the draw data and the reconstucts the draw data after every 100/10 = 10 pages. Use this when smooth scroll with high FPS is important. Reserves some extra memory.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesXY.SampleDataSeries.ScrollingStabilizing
member.summary: Gets or sets if stabilize scrolling mode by rounding shifting to nearest integer pixel position. This is a dependency property. Reduces wobbling of the scrolling waveform, but may show as slight X-dimensional distortion. Only applies when XAxis ScrollMode = Scrolling

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.SeriesXY.SampleDataSeries.ScrollModePointsKeepLevel
member.summary: Tells how often the draw data is cleared when using X axis scroll mode. Valid range is 1...100 1 frees the draw data and the reconstructs the draw data after every 1/10 scroll page. Use this when there's not much memory available. 100 frees the draw data and the reconstructs the draw data after every 100/10 = 10 pages. Use this when smooth scroll with high FPS is important. Reserves some extra memory.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.AntiAliasLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets anti-aliasing factor. 1 = no anti-aliasing. This is a dependency property. The larger the value, the smoother the image will be, but at steep cost of performance on some display adapters. Only objects having AntiAlias property will be anti-aliased, if it's set to 'Normal'.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.D2DEnabled
member.summary: Determines if the D2D system is used or not. Text rendering does not work on DX11 without D2D. This is intended only as Debug measure at this time, and the property will be removed later.

member.summary: Gets or sets if force device create on control resize. Some virtual machine environment require this to be set to true. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.FrameRateLimit
member.summary:
Maximum frames to present in second.
This is a dependency property

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.GPUPreference
member.summary: Gets or sets GPU preference setting. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.HeadlessMode
member.summary:
Defines if the LightningChart expects to have a graphical interface or not. This allows the LC to be used in the background, without connections to interface.
This has effect on multiple different things. For instance device type selection will cause the engine to change instantly on selection, not when LC is connected to visual tree.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.InvokeRenderingInUIThread
member.summary: Gets or sets if use thread safe updates to force the control draw itself though Invoke. This is a dependency property. Enabling this may cause slower updates, and should not be used in applications running without auxiliary threads updating the chart data or properties. Alternatively, you can use Invoke method of your parent form or control. You should always update the chart data from by Invoking in application side.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.LineAAType2D
member.summary: Anti-aliasing type of single pixel width anti-aliased lines for 2D Views. Applicable only on DX11 and when AntiAliasLevel is above 1. Lines thicker than 1 pixel are rendered using triangles, and use triangle drawing AA system. ALAA option produces generally best looking line and is faster than QLAA. There is some problems with ALAA with Warp though.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.LineAAType2DProperty
member.summary: Identifies the LineAAType dependency property for 2D views.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.LineAAType3D
member.summary: Anti-aliasing type of single pixel width anti-aliased lines for 3D Views. Applicable only on DX11 and when AntiAliasLevel is above 1. Lines thicker than 1 pixel are rendered using triangles, and use triangle drawing AA system. ALAA option produces generally best looking line and is faster than QLAA. There is some problems with ALAA with Warp though.

member.name: F:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.LineAAType3DProperty
member.summary: Identifies the LineAAType dependency property for 3D views.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.RenderOptionsCommon.LineOffset
member.summary: Debug Line offset of the DX11 line drawing. LightningChart internally uses coordinate system where the coordinate points to the center of the pixel. Meaning that screen coordinate (0,0) is at the center of the top-left pixel. In DX9 this is the same. In DX11 the point (0,0) is at the top-left corner of the top-left pixel, and the center of the pixel is at point (0.5, 0.5). The points are moved by this offset in DX11 engine, so that the chart can use the same coordinate system with all engines. The default value of (0.5, 0.5) is the "correct" one, but it can be modified by this property.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.LockPointerDeviceHorizRotationAxis
member.summary:
Locks user pointer device (mouse etc) based rotation to use current camera orientation settings for rotation axis. This affects the way horizontal rotation behaves on certain values.
This has no effect when is .
This method is intended mostly as internal operation of LC. It's run when , or properties are changed, causing horizontal rotation axis to be locked based on the current rotation settings. The method has been left as public for special cases, where users need to make the same operation without modifying the rotation parameters.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.MinimumViewDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets minimum View distance. This is a dependency property. Limits the adjust range of ViewDistance. In some cases, you don't want to let the user set the camera too near.

member.summary:
Type of orientation angle definition used in camera orientation. This is a Dependency Property.
This affects how on the orientation angles (, and ) are interpreted and how do they affect the camera orientation / position.
See for more detailed description of options.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.OrthographicCamera
member.summary: This property is obsolete, please use Projection instead. If true uses orthographic camera. Perspective camera is used otherwise. Setting this true causes Projection to be set to OrthographicLegacy. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.RotationX
member.summary:
Part of defining camera orientation and position, by setting its looking direction rotation around X-axis (pitch, elevation) in degrees. This is a dependency property.
Selected Orientation mode () defines how the value affects camera orientation and position. See enumeration for more information.
and needs to be set as well for defining camera orientation. The rotation values are taken into account on a specific order, NOT on the order they are set.
In some orientation modes setting this value causes user device horizontal rotation axis to be set.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.RotationXMaximum
member.summary:
Maximum allowed value of property.
This can be used to limit camera orientation / location to some specific area.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.RotationXMinimum
member.summary:
Minimum allowed value of property.
This can be used to limit camera orientation / location to some specific area.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.RotationY
member.summary:
Part of defining camera orientation and position, by setting its looking direction rotation around Y-axis (Yaw, Heading, Bearing) in degrees. This is a dependency property.
Selected Orientation mode () defines how the value affects camera orientation and position. See enumeration for more information.
and needs to be set as well for defining camera orientation. The rotation values are taken into account on a specific order, NOT on the order they are set.
In some orientation modes setting this value causes user device horizontal rotation axis to be set.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.RotationYMaximum
member.summary:
Maximum allowed value of property.
This can be used to limit camera orientation / location to some specific area.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.RotationYMinimum
member.summary:
Minimum allowed value of property.
This can be used to limit camera orientation / location to some specific area.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.RotationZ
member.summary:
Part of defining camera orientation and position, by setting its looking direction rotation around Z-axis (pitch, elevation) in degrees. This property has highly different effects on different orientation modes. This is a dependency property.
Selected Orientation mode () defines how the value affects camera orientation and position. See enumeration for more information.
and needs to be set as well for defining camera orientation. The rotation values are taken into account on a specific order, NOT on the order they are set.
In some orientation modes setting this value causes user device horizontal rotation axis to be set.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.RotationZMaximum
member.summary:
Maximum allowed value of property.
This can be used to limit camera orientation / location to some specific area.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.RotationZMinimum
member.summary:
Minimum allowed value of property.
This can be used to limit camera orientation / location to some specific area.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.SetEulerAngles(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Same as setting RotationX, RotationY and RotationZ properties separately. Allows easier setting of the properties and is faster than separate setting of the properties.

member.summary: Setter of the far clipping distance for the 3D perspective projection. This is an advanced setting that is not supported in normal use and should not be modified.

member.summary: Setter of the near clipping distance for the 3D perspective projection. This is an advanced setting that is not supported in normal use and should not be modified.

member.param: Predefined camera orientation setting to be used.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets target 3D world coordinate. Camera is targeted towards this coordinate. This is a dependency property. Use (0,0,0) to center in the 3D view. View distance is calculated from this target.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.Camera3D.ViewDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets view distance. This is a dependency property. You should use values in range 10...1000. Distance is calculated from Target

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.View3D.FrameBox
member.summary: On View3D a certain area is selected that axes are shown around. In effect the axes form a cube that the axes are drawn on three edges of. The area is further specified by drawing walls on some of it's faces. The area can also be visualized by drawing a framebox around it. The FrameBox consists of lines drawn along the edges of the cube.

member.name: P:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewXY.AutoYFit.Thorough
member.summary: Gets or sets if all series point in visible X range are searched. This is a dependency property. By using thorough detect method, all series point in visible X range are searched, resulting to accurate fitting, but with cost of extra CPU load. If the detection is not thorough, fitting is not always accurate in real-time monitoring usage.

member.name: T:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewXY.PersistentSeriesRenderingLayer
member.summary: Persistent series rendering layer. Series can be rendered in a bitmap layer and the actual series freed. Saves a lot of memory, CPU and GPU resources, especially when rendering hundreds or thousands of series. The layer itself is rendered in the chart just before line series objects.

member.summary: Zoom the chart in or out. The input parameters in screen coordinates (pixels). If stop point X is greater than start point X, zooms in. If stop point X is less than start point X, fits the view.
member.param: Zoom start point X, in pixels.
Zoom start point Y, in pixels.
Zoom stop point X, in pixels.
Zoom stop point Y, in pixels.

member.name: M:Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.Views.ViewXY.ViewXY.ZoomByFactor(Arction.Wpf.BindableCharting.PointInt,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.param: Zoom center coordinate, default input in DIPs, zooming is made around it. Coordinate must hit the graph area (area between graph margins).
Zoom factor over 1 zooms in, factor in range 0...1 zooms out.
Use DIPs instead of pixels as parameters.
